remarks: Degree of multiplication of two nonzero polynomials when the first leads with a non-zero-divisor coefficient.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 26-Mar-2015.)
statement:
deg1mul2.d $e |- D = ( deg1 ` R ) $.
deg1mul2.p $e |- P = ( Poly1 ` R ) $.
deg1mul2.e $e |- E = ( RLReg ` R ) $.
deg1mul2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` P ) $.
deg1mul2.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` P ) $.
deg1mul2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` P ) $.
deg1mul2.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. Ring ) $.
deg1mul2.fb $e |- ( ph -> F e. B ) $.
deg1mul2.fz $e |- ( ph -> F =/= .0. ) $.
deg1mul2.fc $e |- ( ph -> ( ( coe1 ` F ) ` ( D ` F ) ) e. E ) $.
deg1mul2.gb $e |- ( ph -> G e. B ) $.
deg1mul2.gz $e |- ( ph -> G =/= .0. ) $.
deg1mul2 $p |- ( ph -> ( D ` ( F .x. G ) ) = ( ( D ` F ) + ( D ` G ) ) ) $.
